boolean.name: allow-flight
boolean.doc: Allows users to use flight on the server while in Survival mode, if they have a mod that provides flight installed. With allow-flight enabled, griefers may become more common, because it makes their work easier. In Creative mode, this has no effect.

boolean.name: allow-nether
boolean.doc: Allows players to travel to the Nether. If set to false, Nether portals do not work.

boolean.name: broadcast-console-to-ops
boolean.doc: Send console command outputs to all online operators.

boolean.name: broadcast-rcon-to-ops
boolean.doc: Send rcon console command outputs to all online operators.

integer.name: difficulty
integer.doc: Defines the difficulty (such as damage dealt by mobs and the way hunger and poison affects players) of the server.

boolean.name: enable-command-block
boolean.doc: Enables command blocks.

boolean.name: enable-jmx-monitoring
boolean.doc: Exposes an MBean with the Object name net.minecraft.server:type=Server and two attributes averageTickTime and tickTimes exposing the tick times in milliseconds.

boolean.name: enable-rcon
boolean.doc: Enables remote access to the server console. It's not recommended to expose RCON to the Internet, because RCON protocol transfers everything without encryption.

boolean.name: enable-status
boolean.doc: Makes the server appear as 'online' on the server list. If set to false, it will suppress replies from clients. This means it will appear as offline, but will still accept connections.

boolean.name: enable-query
boolean.doc: Enables GameSpy4 protocol server listener. Used to get information about the server.

boolean.name: enforce-secure-profile
boolean.doc: If set to true, players without a Mojang-signed public key will not be able to connect to the server.

boolean.name: enforce-whitelist
boolean.doc: Enforces the whitelist on the server. When this option is enabled, users who are not present on the whitelist (if it's enabled) get kicked from the server after the server reloads the whitelist file.

integer.name: entity-broadcast-range-percentage
integer.doc: Controls how close entities need to be before being sent to clients. Higher values mean they'll be rendered from farther away, potentially causing more lag.

boolean.name: force-gamemode
boolean.doc: Force players to join in the default game mode. If set to true, players always join in the default gamemode.

integer.name: function-permission-level
integer.doc: Sets the default permission level for functions.

string.name: gamemode
string.doc: Force players to join in the default game mode. If set to true, players always join in the default gamemode.

boolean.name: generate-structures
boolean.doc: Defines whether structures (such as villages) can be generated. Dungeons still generate if this is set to false.

string.name: generator-settings
string.doc: The settings used to customize world generation. Follow its format and write the corresponding JSON string.

boolean.name: hardcore
boolean.doc: If set to true, server difficulty is ignored and set to hard and players are set to spectator mode if they die.

boolean.name: hide-online-players
boolean.doc: If set to true, a player list is not sent on status requests.

string.name: initial-disabled-packs
string.doc: Comma-separated list of datapacks to not be auto-enabled on world creation.

string.name: initial-enabled-packs
string.doc: Comma-separated list of datapacks to be enabled during world creation. Feature packs need to be explicitly enabled.

string.name: level-name
string.doc: The 'level-name' value is used as the world name and its folder name. The player may also copy their saved game folder here, and change the name to the same as that folder's to load it instead.

string.name: level-seed
string.doc: Sets a world seed for the player's world, as in Singleplayer. The world generates with a random seed if left blank.

string.name: level-type
string.doc: Determines the world preset that is generated. Examples include minecraft:normal, minecraft:flat, and minecraft:large_biomes.

integer.name: max-chained-neighbor-updates
integer.doc: Limits the amount of consecutive neighbor updates before skipping additional ones. Negative values remove the limit.

integer.name: max-players
integer.doc: The maximum number of players that can play on the server at the same time. Note that more players on the server consume more resources.

integer.name: max-tick-time
integer.doc: The maximum number of milliseconds a single tick may take before the server watchdog stops the server.

integer.name: max-world-size
integer.doc: Sets the maximum possible size in blocks, expressed as a radius, that the world border can obtain.

string.name: motd
string.doc: This is the message that is displayed in the server list of the client, below the name.

integer.name: network-compression-threshold
integer.doc: Allows packets that are n-1 bytes big to go normally, but a packet of n bytes or more gets compressed down.

boolean.name: online-mode
boolean.doc: Server checks connecting players against the Minecraft account database. Set this to false only if the player's server is not connected to the Internet.

integer.name: op-permission-level
integer.doc: Sets the default permission level for ops when using /op.

integer.name: player-idle-timeout
integer.doc: If non-zero, players are kicked from the server if they are idle for more than that many minutes.

boolean.name: prevent-proxy-connections
boolean.doc: If the ISP/AS sent from the server is different from the one from Mojang Studios' authentication server, the player is kicked.

boolean.name: pvp
boolean.doc: Enable PvP on the server. Players shooting themselves with arrows receive damage only if PvP is enabled.

integer.name: query.port
integer.doc: Sets the port for the query server.

integer.name: rate-limit
integer.doc: Sets the maximum amount of packets a user can send before getting kicked. Setting to 0 disables this feature.

string.name: rcon.password
string.doc: Sets the password for RCON: a remote console protocol that can allow other applications to connect and interact with a Minecraft server over the internet.

string.name: resource-pack
string.doc: Optional URI to a resource pack. The player may choose to use it.

string.name: resource-pack-prompt
string.doc: Optional, adds a custom message to be shown on resource pack prompt when require-resource-pack is used.

string.name: resource-pack-sha1
string.doc: Optional SHA-1 digest of the resource pack, in lowercase hexadecimal. It is used to verify the integrity of the resource pack.

boolean.name: require-resource-pack
boolean.doc: When this option is enabled (set to true), players will be prompted for a response and will be disconnected if they decline the required pack.

string.name: server-ip
string.doc: The player should set this if they want the server to bind to a particular IP. It is strongly recommended that the player leaves server-ip blank.

integer.name: server-port
integer.doc: Changes the port the server is hosting (listening) on.

integer.name: simulation-distance
integer.doc: Sets the maximum distance from players that living entities may be located in order to be updated by the server, measured in chunks in each direction of the player.

boolean.name: snooper-enabled
boolean.doc: Sets whether the server sends snoop data regularly to http://snoop.minecraft.net.

boolean.name: spawn-animals
boolean.doc: Determines if animals can spawn.

boolean.name: spawn-monsters
boolean.doc: Determines if monsters can spawn.

boolean.name: spawn-npcs
boolean.doc: Determines whether villagers can spawn.

integer.name: spawn-protection
integer.doc: Determines the side length of the square spawn protection area as 2x+1.

boolean.name: sync-chunk-writes
boolean.doc: Enables synchronous chunk writes.

boolean.name: use-native-transport
boolean.doc: Linux server performance improvements: optimized packet sending/receiving on Linux.

integer.name: view-distance
integer.doc: Sets the amount of world data the server sends the client, measured in chunks in each direction of the player.

boolean.name: white-list
boolean.doc: Enables a whitelist on the server. With a whitelist enabled, users not on the whitelist cannot connect.
